result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard J. Snider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bernard J. Snider is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bernard J. Snider was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation by 2/2/16.
Must follow requirements of Probation.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  
Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
No contacts continue.
No drugs.

Must provide DNA sample.  No surcharge.
Must take prescriptions as prescribed.

records.addlTxt: #1 - Ltr from Unity Clinic.  Original in 15CF156.

CASES: 15CF156 & 14CF86. Defendant Bernard J. Snider in court with attorney Robert A Wertheimer.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:04 pm.  Exh 1-O&R.  Ct finds elig for SA pgm.    No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

15CF156-Count 3-w/h 1 yr probation.  10 days CT, banked or stayed by probation.  NO drugs.  Take prescriptions as prescribed.  $265.60 fine/costs.  NO DNA sample or surcharge.

15CF156-Count 4-I&S 120 days PCJ, consecutive to count 2 in 14CF86, subj to GT & WR.  1 yr probation.  Follow thru w/ probation & no contacts in place.  $265.60. NO drugs.  Take prescriptions as prescribed.

Sentencing After Revocation - 14CF86-Count 2-w/h sentence, probation up to 2 yrs.  I&S 9 mo PCJ.  $290.60 fine/costs.  Must provide DNA sample, no surcharge.  Follow requirments of probation.  No contacts continue.  NO drugs.  Take prescriptions as prescribed.
PCR.  Must report to probation by 2/2/16.  4:13 pm adj.
from DOC to JLA re PSI
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-01-2016 03:00 pm

CASES: 15CF156 & 14CF86. Defendant Bernard J. Snider in court with attorney Robert A Wertheimer.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:56 am.  
14CF86-Motion to enter JOC to poss of meth granted.  Court enters Judgment.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

15CF156-Counts 1, 2, 5 & 6-DRI.  
Count 3-NC plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  
Count 4 AMENDED to misd bail jumping 946.49(1)(a)-NC plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
